intro: Schradera andina, commonly known as the Andean schradera, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically features palmate leaves with a velvety texture and a distinctive, often fragrant scent. Schradera andina thrives in cool, high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats. Its ornamental value has made it a sought-after plant in horticultural collections.
